title: Composite Binomial Situation
question_text:
Suppose a basketball player shoots $10\text{ free throws}$ per game.
If the season lasts $32\text{ games}$ and the player is an $80\%$ lifetime free-throw shooter, what is the probability that the player makes all $10$ of his free throws during at least one of the games?
Assume each game and each of the free throw attempts is independent.
solution:
First, find:

P( make all 10)=0.810⋅0.20⋅10C0=0.107

Therefore:

P(he doesn’t make all 10)=1–0.107=0.893
